description.narrative: The overall purpose of this Programme is to achieve the UN-Habitat Sub-Programme 4 (Urban Basic Services) objective to:“To increase equitable access to urban basic services and improve the standard of living of the urban poor”.The Expected Accomplishments contributing to this purpose are:EA 1: Improved policies and guidelines on equitable access to sustainable urban basic services implemented by local, regional and national authorities;EA2:Increased flow of investment into equitable urban basic services catalysed by UN-Habitat programmes in partner countries with a focus on urban poor;EA 3: Increased coverage of sustainable urban basic services in targeted communities resulting from UN-Habitat's operational activities in partner cities.AlignmentLocalPrioritiesLocal governments that have expressed interest in energy policies development will be given priorities for technicalassistanceNationalPrioritiesRegionalPrioritiesGlobalPrioritiesCountry and regional activities will be developed on the basis of an analysis of country priorities, policies and plans.Including for example, available Habitat Country Programme documents, medium and long-term country developmentplans, National Climate Change Action Plans (for Mitigation and Adaptation) and major country driven programmes.The selection of particular countries and cities as partners will be based on the clear understanding of the “valueadded”of the UN-Habitat's UBSTF supported programme. Overall, the programme will be guided by needs analysisand a demand driven approach, reflecting agreement with governments and other key stakeholders including forexample the Multilateral Development Banks, Rio+20 and Donors. Global priorities such as those reflected by theSustainable Development Goals framework will also provide a benchmark for the design and implementation ofactivities under the programme. The programme will also leverage the “One UN-Habitat” initiative that seeks topromote cohesive integration between branches and regional officesPage 6 of 17file:///
